837    def __getitem__(self, idx):
838
839        if len(self.cells_out) == 0:
840            out = {
841                "stim": self.stim[idx, :],
842                "robs": self.robs[idx, :],
843                "dfs": self.dfs[idx, :],
844            }
845            if self.speckled:
846                out["Mval"] = self.Mval[idx, :]
847                out["Mtrn"] = self.Mtrn[idx, :]
848
849        else:
850            assert isinstance(self.cells_out, list), "cells_out must be a list"
851            robs_tmp = self.robs[:, self.cells_out]
852            dfs_tmp = self.dfs[:, self.cells_out]
853            out = {
854                "stim": self.stim[idx, :],
855                "robs": robs_tmp[idx, :],
856                "dfs": dfs_tmp[idx, :],
857            }
858            if self.speckled:
859                if self.Mtrn_out is None:
860                    M1tmp = self.Mval[:, self.cells_out]
861                    M2tmp = self.Mtrn[:, self.cells_out]
862                    out["Mval"] = M1tmp[idx, :]
863                    out["Mtrn"] = M2tmp[idx, :]
864                else:
865                    out["Mval"] = self.Mtrn_out[idx, :]
866                    out["Mtrn"] = self.Mtrn_out[idx, :]
867
868        if self.Xdrift is not None:
869            out["Xdrift"] = self.Xdrift[idx, :]
870
871        if self.Xadapt is not None:
872            out["Xadapt"] = self.Xadapt[idx, :]
873
874        if self.ACinput is not None:
875            out["ACinput"] = self.ACinput[idx, :]
876
877        if len(self.covariates) > 0:
878            self.append_covariates(out, idx)
879
880        return out
881
882    # END HNdata.__getitem()

Class for handling HN data.

HNdataset(filename=None, pad_length=None, mask_lags=4, num_lags=10, **kwargs) 
 43    def __init__(
 44        self, filename=None, #which_stim="left", skip_lags=2, # no longer intializes stim here
 45        pad_length=None, # if filled in, will automatically pad (but can be done later)
 46        mask_lags=4,
 47        num_lags=10,
 48        **kwargs
 49    ):
 50        """
 51        Args:
 52            filename: currently the pre-processed matlab file from Dan's old-style format
 53            which_stim: which stim is relevant for the neurons in this dataset (default 'left')
 54            skip_lags: shift stim to throw out early lags
 55            **kwargs: non-dataset specific arguments that get passed into SensoryBase
 56        """
 57        # call parent constructor
 58        super().__init__(filename, num_lags=num_lags, **kwargs)
 59
 60        print(self.datadir + filename)
 61        matdat = sio.loadmat(self.datadir + filename)
 62        print("Loaded " + filename)
 63
 64        self.mask_lags = mask_lags
 65        self.disp_list = matdat["disp_list"].squeeze()
 66        self.stimlist = np.unique(matdat["stimL"])
 67        self.Nstim = len(self.stimlist)
 68        self.hemi_left = matdat["hemisphere"]  # probe in left (1) or right (-1) hemisphere
 69        self.TRcued = matdat["cued"].squeeze()  # Ntr
 70        self.TRchoice = matdat["choice"].squeeze()  # Ntr
 71        self.TRsignal = matdat["signal"]  # Ntr x 2 (sorted by RF)
 72        self.TRstrength = matdat["strength"]  # Ntr x 2 (sorted by RF)
 73        self.TRstim = matdat["cued_stim"]  # Ntr x 4 (sorted by cued, then uncued)
 74        # Detect disparities used for decision (indexed by stimulus number)
 75        # decision_stims = np.where(matdat['disp_list'] == np.unique(matdat['cued_stim'][:,0]))[0]
 76
 77        self.TRstim = np.multiply(
 78            self.TRsignal, self.TRstrength
 79        )  # stim strength and direction combined
 80
 81        # XX new: adding list of all possible frame-lvl disp. vals
 82        # #!! different from disp_list, which contains trial-average disp vals
 83        self.slist = np.unique(self.TRstim)
 84        ### Process neural data
 85        self.robs = torch.tensor(matdat["Robs"], dtype=torch.float32)
 86        self.NT, self.NC = self.robs.shape
 87        # Make/load datafilters
 88        if "dfs" in matdat.keys():
 89            self.dfs = torch.tensor(
 90                matdat["dfs"], dtype=torch.float32
 91            )  # XX is it necessary to float here?
 92        else:
 93            warnings.warn(
 94                "Warning: Data filters matrix 'dfs' not provided. A ones matrix will be created in it's place"
 95            )
 96            self.dfs = torch.zeros([self.NT, self.NC], dtype=torch.float32)
 97            self.used_inds = matdat["used_inds"].squeeze().astype(np.int64) - 1
 98            self.dfs[self.used_inds, :] = 1.0
 99        self.modvars = matdat["moduvar"]
100
101        # High resolution stimuli: note these are already one-hot matrices
102        self.stimL = matdat["stimL"]
103        self.stimR = matdat["stimR"]
104
105        # Saccade info
106        self.Xsacc = torch.tensor(matdat["Xsacc"], dtype=torch.float32)
107        self.Xadapt = None
108        self.ACinput = None  # autoencoder input
109        # saccdirs = matdat['sacc_dirs']
110
111        # Make block_inds
112        blks = matdat["blks"]
113        self.Ntr = blks.shape[0]
114        self.Nframes = np.min(np.diff(blks))
115        for bb in range(self.Ntr):
116            self.block_inds.append( np.arange(blks[bb, 0]-1, blks[bb, 1], dtype=np.int64) )
117            self.dfs[np.arange(blks[bb,0]-1, blks[bb,0]+self.mask_lags-1), :] = 0.0
118            # Take out the first num_lags part of each data-filter
119            #!! Here
120        # self.dfs[np.arange(blks[bb,0]-1, blks[bb,0]+np.maximum(10,self.num_lags+1)), :] = 0.0
121
122        # for some reason there is stuff at the end that is not associated with trial -- cut!
123        self.NT = self.block_inds[-1][-1] + 1
124        self.robs = self.robs[: self.NT, :]
125        self.dfs = self.dfs[: self.NT, :]
126        self.stimL = self.stimL[: self.NT, :]
127        self.stimR = self.stimR[: self.NT, :]
128        self.Xsacc = self.Xsacc[: self.NT, :]
129
130        self.CHnames = [None] * self.NC
131        for cc in range(self.NC):
132            self.CHnames[cc] = matdat["CHnames"][0][cc][0]
133        # expt_info = {'exptname':filename, 'CHnames': CHname, 'blks':blks, 'dec_stims': decision_stims,
134        #            'DispList': dislist, 'StimList': stimlist, #'Xsacc': Xsacc, 'sacc_dirs': saccdirs,
135        #            'stimL': stimL, 'stimR':stimR, 'Robs':Robs, 'used_inds': used_inds}
136
137        twin = np.arange(25, self.Nframes, dtype=np.int64)
138        self.Rtr = np.zeros([self.Ntr, self.NC], dtype="float32")
139        for ii in range(self.Ntr):
140            self.Rtr[ii, :] = torch.sum(self.robs[twin + blks[ii, 0], :], axis=0)
141
142        print(
143            "%d frames, %d units, %d trials with %d frames each"
144            % (self.NT, self.NC, self.Ntr, self.Nframes)
145        )
146
147        chansVX = np.hstack(
148            [
149                matdat["ChnamesV1"],
150                matdat["ChnamesV2"],
151                matdat["ChnamesV3"],
152                matdat["ChnamesV4"],
153                matdat["ChnamesXX"],
154            ]
155        )
156        chansVX_id = np.hstack(
157            [
158                np.repeat("v1", matdat["ChnamesV1"].shape[1]),
159                np.repeat("v2", matdat["ChnamesV2"].shape[1]),
160                np.repeat("v3", matdat["ChnamesV3"].shape[1]),
161                np.repeat("v4", matdat["ChnamesV4"].shape[1]),
162                np.repeat("xx", matdat["ChnamesXX"].shape[1]),
163            ]
164        )
165        chansVX = (
166            chansVX + np.random.rand(len(chansVX)) * 0.001
167        )  # so that the numbers don't repeat
168        indices = np.argsort(chansVX)
169        self.chan_area = chansVX_id[indices]
170        
171        # Figure out minimum and max trial size, and then make function that fits anywhere
172        self.min_trial_size = len(self.block_inds[0])
173        self.max_trial_size = len(self.block_inds[0])
174        for ii in range(self.Ntr):
175            if len(self.block_inds[ii]) < self.min_trial_size:
176                self.min_trial_size = len(self.block_inds[ii])
177            elif len(self.block_inds[ii]) > self.max_trial_size:
178                self.max_trial_size = len(self.block_inds[ii])

189        #    f_far[nn,1] = np.sum(TRchoice[tr2] > 0)/len(tr2)

192        # self.assemble_stim( which_stim=which_stim, skip_lags=skip_lags )
193
194        # Make drift-design matrix using anchor points at each cycle
195        if self.drift_interval is None:
196            cued_transitions = np.where(abs(np.diff(self.TRcued)) > 0)[0]
197            anchors = [0] + list(cued_transitions[range(1, len(cued_transitions), 2)])
198            self.construct_drift_design_matrix(block_anchors=anchors, zero_right=True)
199        else:
200            raise ValueError(
201                "drift_interval is not supported for this dataset. The drift matrix is constructed based on cue transitions. Please omit the drift_intervsal argument and try creating a data instance again."
202            )
203            # self.construct_drift_design_matrix()
204
205        # This needs to be an internal variable
206        if pad_length is None:
207            self.trial_padding = 0
208        else:
209            self.pad_trials( pad_length=pad_length )

def assing_train_test_inds(self, which_fold=2, fold_num=5, use_random=False): 
212    def assing_train_test_inds(self, which_fold=2, fold_num=5, use_random=False):
213        # Generate cross-validation
214        use_random = use_random
215        # Cued and uncued trials
216        trC = np.where(self.TRcued > 0)[0]
217        trU = np.where(self.TRcued < 0)[0]
218        # zero-strength trials
219        tr0 = np.where(self.TRstrength[:, 0] == 0)[0]
220        # sort by cued/uncued
221        tr0C = np.where((self.TRstrength[:, 0] == 0) & (self.TRcued > 0))[0]
222        tr0U = np.where((self.TRstrength[:, 0] == 0) & (self.TRcued < 0))[0]
223        # for purposes of cross-validation, do the same for non-zero-strength trials
224        trXC = np.where((self.TRstrength[:, 0] != 0) & (self.TRcued > 0))[0]
225        trXU = np.where((self.TRstrength[:, 0] != 0) & (self.TRcued < 0))[0]
226
227        # Assign train and test indices sampled evenly from each subgroup (note using default 4-fold)
228        Ut0C, Xt0C = self.train_test_assign(
229            tr0C, use_random=use_random, which_fold=which_fold, fold_num=fold_num, 
230        )
231        Ut0U, Xt0U = self.train_test_assign(
232            tr0U, use_random=use_random, which_fold=which_fold, fold_num=fold_num, 
233        )
234        UtXC, XtXC = self.train_test_assign(
235            trXC, use_random=use_random, which_fold=which_fold, fold_num=fold_num, 
236        )
237        UtXU, XtXU = self.train_test_assign(
238            trXU, use_random=use_random, which_fold=which_fold, fold_num=fold_num, 
239        )
240
241        # Putting together for larger groups
242        Ut0 = np.sort(np.concatenate((Ut0C, Ut0U), axis=0))
243        Xt0 = np.sort(np.concatenate((Xt0C, Xt0U), axis=0))
244        UtC = np.sort(np.concatenate((Ut0C, UtXC), axis=0))
245        XtC = np.sort(np.concatenate((Xt0C, XtXC), axis=0))
246        UtU = np.sort(np.concatenate((Ut0U, UtXU), axis=0))
247        XtU = np.sort(np.concatenate((Xt0U, XtXU), axis=0))
248
249        Ut = np.sort(np.concatenate((Ut0, UtXC, UtXU), axis=0))
250        Xt = np.sort(np.concatenate((Xt0, XtXC, XtXU), axis=0))
251
252        self.trs = {"c": trC, "u": trU, "0": tr0, "0c": tr0C, "0u": tr0U}
253        self.Utr = {"all": Ut, "0": Ut0, "c": UtC, "u": UtU, "0c": Ut0C, "0u": Ut0U}
254        self.Xtr = {"all": Xt, "0": Xt0, "c": XtC, "u": XtU, "0c": Xt0C, "0u": Xt0U}
255
256        train_inds, val_inds = [], []
257        for tr in Ut:
258            train_inds = np.concatenate(
259                (train_inds, self.block_inds[tr]), axis=0
260            ).astype(np.int64)
261        for tr in Xt:
262            val_inds = np.concatenate(
263                (val_inds, self.block_inds[tr]), axis=0
264            ).astype(np.int64)
265        return train_inds, val_inds

def pad_trials(self, pad_length=10): 
274    def pad_trials(self, pad_length=10):
275        '''
276        Pads the end of each trial with additional empty timepoints. (could be the end if we want)
277        Modfies the following:
278            -- block_inds, and sets trial_padding
279            -- robs and dfs
280            -- stimL and stimR (and nulls stimulus to make sure it is reassembled)
281            -- Xdrift and Xsacc
282            -- modvars: whatever that is
283            -- will null any covariates, which have to be remade
284
285        Args:
286            pad_length: how much to pad after each trial (default 10)
287
288        Returns:
289            None, although modifies all the design matrices and data listed above
290        '''
291
292        self.trial_padding = pad_length
293        tot_rows = self.robs.shape[0] + pad_length*len(self.block_inds)
294
295        indsx = deepcopy(self.block_inds)
296        #robsx=np.full((tot_rows, self.robs.shape[1]), np.nan)
297        #dfx=np.full((tot_rows, self.robs.shape[1]), np.nan)
298        robsx = torch.zeros((tot_rows, self.robs.shape[1]), dtype=torch.float32) # changed from nans to zeros
299        dfx = torch.zeros((tot_rows, self.robs.shape[1]), dtype=torch.float32) # changed from nans to zeros
300        # Unassembled stimulus stored as numpy (not torch)
301        stimLx = np.zeros((tot_rows, self.stimL.shape[1]), dtype=np.float32) 
302        stimRx = np.zeros((tot_rows, self.stimR.shape[1]), dtype=np.float32) 
303
304        driftx = torch.zeros((tot_rows, self.Xdrift.shape[1]), dtype=torch.float32) # changed from nans to zeros
305        saccx = torch.zeros((tot_rows, self.Xsacc.shape[1]), dtype=torch.float32) # changed from nans to zeros
306
307        modvarx = np.zeros((tot_rows, self.modvars.shape[1]), dtype=np.float32) 
308
309        if len(self.stim) > 0:
310            print("PADDING: Erasing existing stimulus: must reaseemble")
311            self.stim = []
312        if len(self.covariates) > 0:
313            print("PADDING: Erasing existing covariates: must rebuild")
314            self.covariates = {}
315
316        total_pad = 0 # total padding accumulator
317        for t in range(len(self.block_inds)):   
318            #add padding
319            
320            #indsx[t] = indsx[t]+total_pad # commented out: new trials must include gap
321            new_inds = indsx[t]+total_pad
322            #pad_array=np.arange(indsx[t][-1]+1, indsx[t][-1]+pad_length+1)
323            #indsx[t] = np.concatenate((indsx[t], pad_array))
324            
325            robsx[new_inds, :] = self.robs[self.block_inds[t], :]
326            dfx[new_inds, :] = self.dfs[self.block_inds[t], :]
327            stimLx[new_inds, :] = self.stimL[self.block_inds[t], :]
328            stimRx[new_inds, :] = self.stimR[self.block_inds[t], :]
329            saccx[new_inds, :] = self.Xsacc[self.block_inds[t], :]
330            driftx[new_inds, :] = self.Xdrift[self.block_inds[t], :]
331            modvarx[new_inds, :] = self.modvars[self.block_inds[t], :]
332            #for cell in range(self.robs.shape[1]):
333            #    robi = self.robs[self.block_inds[t],cell]
334            #    robsx[indsx[t], cell] = torch.cat(
335            #        (robi,
336            #        torch.zeros(len(range(pad_length)))
337            #        )
338            #    )
339            #    dfi = self.dfs[self.block_inds[t],cell]
340            #    dfx[indsx[t],cell] = torch.cat(
341            #        (dfi,
342            #        torch.zeros(len(range(pad_length)))
343            #        )
344            #    )
345
346            # Now that data is written in, need to make each trial include the gap so
347            # that datasets can be assembled trial-by-trial (preserving the gaps)
348            indsx[t] = np.arange(new_inds[0], new_inds[-1]+1+pad_length)
349            total_pad += pad_length
350
351        self.block_inds = indsx
352        #self.robs=torch.from_numpy(robsx)
353        #self.dfs=torch.from_numpy(dfx)
354        self.robs = robsx
355        self.dfs = dfx
356        self.stimL = stimLx
357        self.stimR = stimRx
358        self.modvars = modvarx  # not sure what this is but needs to be expanded
359        self.Xdrift = driftx
360        self.Xsacc = saccx
361        self.NT = tot_rows

def split_CU(self, design_matrix): 
364    def split_CU(self, design_matrix):
365        """
366        Splits design matrix by cued / uncued conditions and then concatenates columns
367        """
368        Xcued = deepcopy(design_matrix)
369        Xuncued = deepcopy(design_matrix)
370
371        for t in range(self.Ntr):
372            if t in self.trs["c"]:
373                Xuncued[self.block_inds[t], :] = 0.0
374            elif t in self.trs["u"]:
375                Xcued[self.block_inds[t], :] = 0.0
376        XCU = np.concatenate((Xcued, Xuncued), axis=1)
377        return XCU

def mark_good_cells( self, thresh_reject_var: float = None, thresh_reject_mean: float = None) -> None: 
379    def mark_good_cells(self, thresh_reject_var: float=None, thresh_reject_mean:float=None) -> None:
380        """
381        Creates a 'keepers' atribute, which is a list of 'good' cells,
382            based on mean & variance threshold criteria.
383        thresh_reject_mean: specifies how much mean activity can vary across
384            the length of the session (which is divided into 3 equal parts).
385        thresh_reject_var: specifies how much variance can vary across the length 
386          of the session
387        """
388        if thresh_reject_var is not None:
389            keepers_var = self.var_test(thresh_reject_var)
390        else:
391            keepers_var = range(self.NC)    
392        if thresh_reject_mean is not None:
393            keepers_mean = self.mean_test(thresh_reject_mean)    
394        else:
395            keepers_mean = range(self.NC)
396        self.keepers_var = keepers_var
397        self.keepers_mean = keepers_mean
398        self.keepers = np.intersect1d(keepers_var, keepers_mean)

Creates a 'keepers' atribute, which is a list of 'good' cells, based on mean & variance threshold criteria. thresh_reject_mean: specifies how much mean activity can vary across the length of the session (which is divided into 3 equal parts). thresh_reject_var: specifies how much variance can vary across the length of the session

def mean_test(self, thresh_reject: float = 2.0) -> numpy.ndarray: 
400    def mean_test(self, thresh_reject: float=2.0) -> np.ndarray:
401        """
402         Mark good cells based on mean criterium,
403         using dfs to account for partial missing data.
404         Provides a simple interpretation: the variance in any third
405           part of the session cannot be more than twice the variance in the other two thirds.
406        """
407        trial_bool = np.zeros([self.Ntr, self.NC], dtype=bool)
408        meantest = np.zeros([self.NC, 3])
409        num, deno = np.zeros(self.NC), np.zeros(self.NC)
410        for cc in range(self.NC):
411            dfs = self.dfs[:, cc]
412            tp_used = np.where(dfs==1)[0]
413            for (i, tr) in enumerate(self.block_inds):
414                trial_bool[i,cc]=(np.isin(tr, tp_used)).all()
415            rtr_cc = self.Rtr[trial_bool[:,cc], cc]
416            meantest[cc, 0] = np.mean(rtr_cc[range(len(rtr_cc) // 3)])
417            meantest[cc, 1] = np.mean(rtr_cc[range(len(rtr_cc) // 3, 2 *len(rtr_cc) // 3)])
418            meantest[cc, 2] = np.mean(rtr_cc[range(2 *len(rtr_cc) // 3,len( rtr_cc))])
419            num[cc] = np.max([meantest[cc, 0], meantest[cc, 1] , meantest[cc, 2]])
420            deno[cc] = np.min([meantest[cc, 0],meantest[cc, 1], meantest[cc, 2]])
421
422        criteria_reject = np.divide(num,deno)
423        if thresh_reject > 0:
424            out= np.where(criteria_reject < thresh_reject)[0]
425        else: 
426            out= criteria_reject
427        return out

Mark good cells based on mean criterium, using dfs to account for partial missing data. Provides a simple interpretation: the variance in any third part of the session cannot be more than twice the variance in the other two thirds.

def var_test(self, thresh_reject: float = 1.5) -> numpy.ndarray: 
429    def var_test(self, thresh_reject:float=1.5) -> np.ndarray:
430        """
431         Mark good cells based on variance criterium,
432         using dfs to account for partial missing data.
433         Provides a simple interpretation: the variance in any third
434           part of the session cannot be more than twice the variance in the other two thirds.
435        """
436        trial_bool = np.zeros([self.Ntr, self.NC], dtype=bool)
437        vartest = np.zeros([self.NC, 3])
438        num, deno = np.zeros(self.NC), np.zeros(self.NC)
439        for cc in range(self.NC):
440            dfs = self.dfs[:, cc]
441            tp_used = np.where(dfs==1)[0]
442            for (i, tr) in enumerate(self.block_inds):
443                trial_bool[i,cc]=(np.isin(tr, tp_used)).all()
444            rtr_cc = self.Rtr[trial_bool[:,cc], cc]
445            vartest[cc, 0] = np.std(rtr_cc[range(len(rtr_cc) // 3)])
446            vartest[cc, 1] = np.std(rtr_cc[range(len(rtr_cc) // 3, 2 *len(rtr_cc) // 3)])
447            vartest[cc, 2] = np.std(rtr_cc[range(2 *len(rtr_cc) // 3,len( rtr_cc))])
448            num[cc] = np.max([vartest[cc, 0], vartest[cc, 1] , vartest[cc, 2]])
449            deno[cc] = np.min([vartest[cc, 0],vartest[cc, 1], vartest[cc, 2]])
450
451        criteria_reject = np.divide(num,deno)
452        if thresh_reject > 0:
453            out= np.where(criteria_reject < thresh_reject)[0]
454        else: 
455            out= criteria_reject
456        return out

Mark good cells based on variance criterium, using dfs to account for partial missing data. Provides a simple interpretation: the variance in any third part of the session cannot be more than twice the variance in the other two thirds.

def get_psycurve(self) -> None: 
458    def get_psycurve(self) -> None:
459        """
460        Returns a 2D array specifying contrast (disparity) level (rows)
461            for attended and unattended (columns) stimuli. Used for plotting
462            psychophysiological curves.
463        """
464        Ntr = len(self.block_inds)
465        TRstims, TRstimsOPP = np.zeros(Ntr), np.zeros(Ntr)
466        cued_inds = 1 - (self.TRcued + 1) // 2  # transforms to 0-1 for indexing
467        for ii in range(Ntr):
468            TRstims[ii] = self.TRstim[ii, cued_inds[ii]]
469            TRstimsOPP[ii] = self.TRstim[ii, 1 - cued_inds[ii]]
470
471        #
472        psycurves = np.zeros([len(self.slist), 2])
473        for ss in range(len(self.slist)):
474            trs = np.where(TRstims == self.slist[ss])[0]
475            psycurves[ss, 0] = np.mean(self.TRchoice[trs])
476            trs = np.where(TRstimsOPP == self.slist[ss])[0]
477            psycurves[ss, 1] = np.mean(self.TRchoice[trs])
478        self.psycurves = psycurves

Returns a 2D array specifying contrast (disparity) level (rows) for attended and unattended (columns) stimuli. Used for plotting psychophysiological curves.

def trial_to_timepoint(self, TRvar: numpy.ndarray, col_num: int) -> numpy.ndarray: 
480    def trial_to_timepoint(self, TRvar: np.ndarray, col_num: int) -> np.ndarray:
481        """
482        Takes a trial-level dataset variable (e.g. average disparity per trial)
483            and broadcasts it across time-points, creating a tp-level variable
484        col_num: specifies which column of the trial-lvl variable to transform
485        """
486        out = np.zeros(self.robs.shape[0])
487        for tr, blk in enumerate(self.block_inds):
488            out[blk[0] : blk[-1]] = TRvar[tr, col_num]
489        return out

Takes a trial-level dataset variable (e.g. average disparity per trial) and broadcasts it across time-points, creating a tp-level variable col_num: specifies which column of the trial-lvl variable to transform

@staticmethod
def get_sacc_dir(rad_angle: torch.Tensor, type: str) -> torch.Tensor: 
491    @staticmethod
492    def get_sacc_dir(rad_angle: torch.Tensor, type: str) -> torch.Tensor:
493        """
494        Discretizes an array of angles "rad_angle" (in radians) in 3 ways:
495        1. type='lr' categorizes directions into left and right
496            and outputs a 2 column binary array, for
497            whether the direction was left (col 1) or right (col 2)
498        2. type = 'ud': same as 1, but for up/down saccades
499        3. type = 'lrud': categorizes directions into 4 types: left (col 1),
500        right (col 2), up (col 3) and down (col 4).
501        """
502        deg_angle = 180 / math.pi * rad_angle
503        if type.lower() == "lr":
504            right = ((deg_angle > 0) & (deg_angle < 90) | (deg_angle > 270)).long()
505            left = (deg_angle > 90) & (deg_angle < 270).long()
506            out = torch.column_stack((left, right))
507        elif type.lower() == "ud":
508            up = ((deg_angle > 0) & (deg_angle < 180)).long()
509            down = ((deg_angle > 180) & (deg_angle < 360)).long()
510            out = torch.column_stack((up, down))
511        elif type.lower() == "lrud" or type.lower() == "udlr":
512            right = ((deg_angle > 315) | ((deg_angle > 0) & (deg_angle < 45))).long()
513            left = ((deg_angle > 135) & (deg_angle < 225)).long()
514            up = ((deg_angle > 45) & (deg_angle < 135)).long()
515            down = ((deg_angle > 225) & (deg_angle < 315)).long()
516            out = torch.column_stack((left, right, up, down))
517        return out

Discretizes an array of angles "rad_angle" (in radians) in 3 ways:

  1. type='lr' categorizes directions into left and right and outputs a 2 column binary array, for whether the direction was left (col 1) or right (col 2)
  2. type = 'ud': same as 1, but for up/down saccades
  3. type = 'lrud': categorizes directions into 4 types: left (col 1), right (col 2), up (col 3) and down (col 4).
def set_num_lags(self, stim_interval, verbose=False): 
519    def set_num_lags(self, stim_interval, verbose=False):
520        samples_per_trial = self.NT / len(self.block_inds)
521        sampling_rate = 2000 / samples_per_trial
522        if verbose:

524        return np.ceil(stim_interval / sampling_rate)

527        """

531            which_stim: 'left' or 'right' (default 'left')

def design_matrix_attentuation(self, num_segs=8): 
629    def design_matrix_attentuation( self, num_segs=8):
630        """
631        blksI is the data.block_inds information.
632        num_segs says how many tent_bases should be used across trial
633        onset_period (0-1): proportion of the trial modelled as stim onset
634        onset_seg_len (int): how long should be the segments during onset period
635        """
636
637        # Compute max trial length
638        blksI = self.block_inds
639        num_trials = len(blksI)
640        NTtrial = np.zeros(num_trials)
641        for ii in range(num_trials):
642            NTtrial[ii] = len(blksI[ii])
643
644        # make one-trial design-matrix
645        L = np.max(NTtrial).astype(int)
646        #Tseg = np.mean(L * (1 - onset_period) / num_segs).astype(int)
647
648        ## SQRT-spacing
649        anchors = np.round(self.mask_lags + np.linspace(0,np.sqrt(L-self.mask_lags),num_segs+1)**2).astype(int)[:-1]
650        print('Anchors:', anchors)
651        #anchors = np.concatenate(
652        #    (
653        #        np.arange(0, L * onset_period, onset_seg_len),
654        #        np.arange(L * onset_period, L + 1, Tseg),
655        #    )
656        #).astype(int)
657
658        Xtrial_time = self.design_matrix_drift(L, anchors=anchors, 
659                                                const_left=True, zero_left=False, zero_right=True)
660        # place them on every trial
661        X = np.zeros([blksI[-1][-1] + 1, Xtrial_time.shape[1]])
662        for ii in range(num_trials):
663            X[blksI[ii], :] = deepcopy(Xtrial_time[range(len(blksI[ii])), :])
664        return X

blksI is the data.block_inds information. num_segs says how many tent_bases should be used across trial onset_period (0-1): proportion of the trial modelled as stim onset onset_seg_len (int): how long should be the segments during onset period

def construct_Xadapt(self, tent_spacing=12, cueduncued=False): 
667    def construct_Xadapt(self, tent_spacing=12, cueduncued=False):
668        """
669        Constructs adaptation-within-trial tent function
670
671        Args:
672            num_tents: default 11
673            cueduncued: whether to fit separate kernels to cued/uncued
674
675        Returns:
676            None
677        """
678        # automatically wont have any anchors past min_trial_size
679        anchors = np.arange(0, self.min_trial_size, tent_spacing)
680        # Generate master tent_basis
681        trial_tents = self.design_matrix_drift(
682            self.max_trial_size,
683            anchors,
684            zero_left=False,
685            zero_right=True,
686            const_right=False,
687        )
688        num_tents = trial_tents.shape[1]
689
690        if cueduncued:
691            self.Xadapt = torch.zeros((self.NT, 2 * num_tents), dtype=torch.float32)
692        else:
693            self.Xadapt = torch.zeros((self.NT, num_tents), dtype=torch.float32)
694
695        for tr in range(self.Ntr):
696            L = len(self.block_inds[tr])
697            if cueduncued:
698                tmp = torch.zeros([L, 2 * num_tents], dtype=torch.float32)
699                if self.TRcued[tr] < 0:
700                    tmp[:, range(num_tents, 2 * num_tents)] = torch.tensor(
701                        trial_tents[:L, :], dtype=torch.float32
702                    )
703                else:
704                    tmp[:, range(num_tents)] = torch.tensor(
705                        trial_tents[:L, :], dtype=torch.float32
706                    )
707                self.Xadapt[self.block_inds[tr], :] = deepcopy(tmp)
708            else:
709                self.Xadapt[self.block_inds[tr], :] = torch.tensor(
710                    trial_tents[:L, :], dtype=torch.float32
711                )

def autoencoder_design_matrix(self, pre_win=0, post_win=0, blank=0, cells=None): 
715    def autoencoder_design_matrix(self, pre_win=0, post_win=0, blank=0, cells=None):
716        """
717        Makes auto-encoder input using windows described above, and including the
718        chosen cells. Will put as additional covariate "ACinput" in __get_item__
719
720        Args:
721            pre_win: how many time steps to include before origin
722            post_win: how many time steps to include after origin
723            blank: how many time steps to blank in each direction, including origin
724
725        Returns:
726            None
727        """
728
729        if cells is None:
730            cells = np.arange(self.NC)
731        Rraw = deepcopy(self.robs[:, cells])
732        self.ACinput = torch.zeros(Rraw.shape, dtype=torch.float32)
733        nsteps = 0
734        if blank == 0:
735            self.ACinput += Rraw
736            nsteps = 1
737        for ii in range(1, (pre_win + 1)):
738            self.ACinput[ii:, :] += Rraw[:(-ii), :]
739            nsteps += 1
740        for ii in range(1, (post_win + 1)):
741            self.ACinput[:(-ii), :] += Rraw[ii:, :]
742            nsteps += 1
743        assert nsteps > 0, "autoencoder design: invalid parameters"
744        self.ACinput *= 1.0 / nsteps
745        self.ACinput *= self.dfs[:, cells]

  • post_win: how many time steps to include after origin
  • blank: how many time steps to blank in each direction, including origin

@staticmethod
def train_test_assign(trial_ns, fold_num=5, which_fold=2, use_random=False): 
777    @staticmethod
778    def train_test_assign(
779        trial_ns, fold_num=5, which_fold=2, use_random=False
780    ):  # this should be a static function
781        """
782        Assigns trials to training and test sets.
783
784        Args:
785            trial_ns: trial numbers
786            fold_num: number of folds (default 4)
787            use_random: whether to use random assignment (default True)
788
789        Returns:
790            utr: trial numbers for training set
791            xtr: trial numbers for test set
792        """
793        num_tr = len(trial_ns)
794        if use_random:
795            permu = np.random.permutation(num_tr)
796            xtr = np.sort(trial_ns[permu[range(np.floor(num_tr / fold_num).astype(int))]])
797            utr = np.sort(
798                trial_ns[permu[range(np.floor(num_tr / fold_num).astype(int), num_tr)]]
799            )
800        else:
801            xlist = np.arange(which_fold, num_tr, fold_num, dtype="int32")
802            ulist = np.setdiff1d(np.arange(num_tr), xlist)
803            xtr = trial_ns[xlist]
804            utr = trial_ns[ulist]
805        return utr, xtr

Assigns trials to training and test sets.

Arguments:
  • trial_ns: trial numbers
  • fold_num: number of folds (default 4)
  • use_random: whether to use random assignment (default True)
Returns:

utr: trial numbers for training set xtr: trial numbers for test set

832            chnames.append(chn)
833        if display_names:

class MotionNeural(typing.Generic[+T_co]): 
 885class MotionNeural(SensoryBase):
 886    """
 887    Class for handling motion neural data.
 888    """
 889
 890    def __init__(self, filename=None, num_lags=30, tr_gap=10, **kwargs):
 891        """
 892        Args:
 893            num_lags: number of lags to include in stimulus (default 30)
 894            tr_gap: number of frames to blank out after each trial (default 10)
 895            filename: currently the pre-processed matlab file from Dan's old-style format
 896            datadir: directory for data (goes directly into SensoryBase)
 897            **kwargs: non-dataset specific arguments that get passed into SensoryBase
 898        """
 899
 900        # Call parent constructor
 901        super().__init__(filename, **kwargs)
 902        matdat = sio.loadmat(self.datadir + filename)
 903        print("Loaded " + filename)
 904
 905        # Essential variables
 906        self.robs = torch.tensor(matdat["robs"], dtype=torch.float32)
 907        self.NT = len(self.robs)
 908        self.dfs = torch.tensor(matdat["rf_criteria"], dtype=torch.float32)
 909        self.NC = self.robs.shape[1]
 910        self.ACinput = None  # autoencoder input
 911
 912        # Use stim onsets for stim timing (starts with black)
 913        self.stimB = matdat["stimB"][:, 0].astype(np.float32)
 914        self.stimW = matdat["stimW"][:, 0].astype(np.float32)
 915        self.trial_stim = matdat["trial_stim"].astype(np.float32)
 916        self.stimts = np.where(np.diff(self.stimB) > 0)[0] + 1
 917        self.flash_stim = torch.zeros([self.NT, 1], dtype=torch.float32)
 918        self.flash_stim[self.stimts] = 1.0
 919        self.dims = [1, 1, 1, 1]
 920        self.Xadapt = None
 921
 922        # Make trial block and classify trials
 923        blocks = matdat["blocks"] - 1  # Convert to python indexing
 924        trial_type_t = matdat["trial_type"][:, 0]
 925        Ntr = len(blocks)
 926        self.trial_type = np.zeros(Ntr, dtype=np.int64)  # 1=free viewing, 2=fixation
 927        for bb in range(Ntr):
 928            if bb < Ntr - 1:
 929                self.block_inds.append(np.arange(blocks[bb], blocks[bb + 1]))
 930            else:
 931                self.block_inds.append(np.arange(blocks[bb], self.NT))
 932            self.trial_type[bb] = np.median(trial_type_t[self.block_inds[bb]])
 933
 934        # Mask out blinks using data_filters +/ 4 frames around each blink
 935        self.blinks = matdat["blinks"][:, 0].astype(np.float32)
 936        valid_data = 1 - self.blinks
 937        blink_onsets = np.where(np.diff(self.blinks) > 0)[0] + 1
 938        blink_offsets = np.where(np.diff(self.blinks) > 0)[0] + 1
 939        for ii in range(len(blink_onsets)):
 940            valid_data[
 941                range(
 942                    np.maximum(0, blink_onsets[ii] - 4),
 943                    np.minimum(self.NT, blink_offsets[ii] + 4),
 944                )
 945            ] = 0.0
 946        self.dfs *= valid_data[:, None]
 947        if tr_gap > 0:
 948            for bb in range(Ntr):
 949                self.dfs[self.block_inds[bb][:tr_gap], :] = 0.0
 950
 951        # Saccades
 952        self.saccades = matdat["saccades"][:, 0].astype(np.float32)
 953        saccade_onsets = np.where(np.diff(self.saccades) > 0)[0] + 1
 954        saccade_offsets = np.where(np.diff(self.saccades) < 0)[0] + 1
 955        self.sacc_on = torch.zeros([self.NT, 1], dtype=torch.float32)
 956        self.sacc_on[saccade_onsets] = 1.0
 957        self.sacc_off = torch.zeros([self.NT, 1], dtype=torch.float32)
 958        self.sacc_off[saccade_offsets] = 1.0
 959
 960        # Non-essential
 961        self.eye_pos = matdat["eye_pos"]
 962        self.eye_speed = matdat["eye_speed"][:, 0]
 963        self.framerate = matdat["framerate"][0, 0]
 964        # Bharath's used time points
 965        self.BTtimepts = matdat["timepts2use"][0, :] - 1  # Convert to python indexing
 966
 967        # Make drift term -- need anchors at every other cycle
 968        transitions = np.where(abs(np.diff(self.trial_type)) > 0)[0] + 1
 969        drift_anchors = [0] + list(
 970            transitions[np.arange(1, len(transitions), 2)]
 971        )  # every other transition
 972        self.construct_drift_design_matrix(block_anchors=drift_anchors)
 973
 974        self.crossval_setup(test_set=False)
 975
 976        if num_lags is not None:
 977            self.assemble_stimulus(num_lags=num_lags)
 978
 979    # END MotionNeural.__init__

 981    def assemble_stimulus(self, which_stim="all", use_trial_type=False, num_lags=180):
 982        """
 983        Assembles stimulus for dataset.
 984
 985        Args:
 986            which_stim: could be 'trial' (default) using just the first stim onset" or could
 987                mark each flash (calling 'which_stim' anything else), although this would not implicitly
 988                take things like adapation into account
 989            use_trial_type: could fit different stim responses in the two conditions to gauge the effects
 990            num_lags: number of lags to include in stimulus (default 180)
 991        """
 992
 993        self.num_lags = num_lags
 994        if which_stim == "trial":
 995            stim = self.trial_stim
 996        else:
 997            stim = self.flash_stim.detach().numpy()
 998
 999        if use_trial_type:
1000            stim2 = np.concatenate((deepcopy(stim), deepcopy(stim)), axis=1)
1001            for bb in range(len(self.block_inds)):
1002                stim2[self.block_inds[bb], self.trial_type[bb] - 1] = 0.0
1003                # this will have stim present in 0 for fixation and 1 for free viewing
1004            self.stim = self.time_embedding(stim=stim2, nlags=num_lags)
1005            self.sac_dims = [2, 1, 1, num_lags]
1006        else:
1007            self.stim = self.time_embedding(stim=stim, nlags=num_lags)
1008            self.sac_dims = [1, 1, 1, num_lags]
1009
1010    # END MotionNeural.assemble_stimulus()

1012    def construct_Xadapt(self, tent_start=18 + 8, tent_spacing=20):
1013        """
1014        Constructs adaptation-within-trial tent function
1015        Args:
1016            tent_start: starting point for tent basis
1017            tent_spacing: spacing between tent basis
1018
1019        Returns:
1020            None
1021        """
1022        # Put first anchor
1023        anchors = tent_start + tent_spacing * np.arange(
1024            0, 6
1025        )  # 5 pulses (ignoring first)
1026
1027        # Generate master tent_basis
1028        trial_tents = self.design_matrix_drift(
1029            len(self.block_inds[0]),
1030            anchors,
1031            zero_left=True,
1032            const_left=True,
1033            zero_right=False,
1034            const_right=True,
1035        )
1036        num_tents = trial_tents.shape[1]
1037
1038        self.Xadapt = torch.zeros((self.NT, num_tents), dtype=torch.float32)
1039
1040        for tr in range(len(self.block_inds)):
1041            L = len(self.block_inds[tr])
1042            self.Xadapt[self.block_inds[tr], :] = torch.tensor(
1043                trial_tents[:L, :], dtype=torch.float32
1044            )

1048    def autoencoder_design_matrix(
1049        self, trial_level=False, pre_win=0, post_win=0, blank=0, cells=None
1050    ):
1051        """
1052        Makes auto-encoder input using windows described above, and including the
1053        chosen cells. Will put as additional covariate "ACinput" in __get_item__
1054
1055        Args:
1056            trial_level: whether to average over trials
1057            pre_win: how many time steps to include before origin
1058            post_win: how many time steps to include after origin
1059            blank: how many time steps to blank in each direction, including origin
1060            cells: which cells to include
1061        """
1062
1063        if cells is None:
1064            cells = np.arange(self.NC)
1065        Rraw = deepcopy(self.robs[:, cells])
1066        self.ACinput = torch.zeros(Rraw.shape, dtype=torch.float32)
1067
1068        if trial_level:
1069            assert (
1070                len(self.block_inds) > 0
1071            ), "No trials: trial-level autoencoder will not work."
1072            for tt in range(len(self.block_inds)):
1073                ts = self.block_inds[tt]
1074                self.ACinput[ts, :] = (
1075                    torch.ones([len(ts), 1]) @ torch.mean(Rraw[ts, :], axis=0)[None, :]
1076                )
1077        else:
1078            nsteps = 0
1079            if blank == 0:
1080                self.ACinput += Rraw
1081                nsteps = 1
1082            for ii in range(1, (pre_win + 1)):
1083                self.ACinput[ii:, :] += Rraw[:(-ii), :]
1084                nsteps += 1
1085            for ii in range(1, (post_win + 1)):
1086                self.ACinput[:(-ii), :] += Rraw[ii:, :]
1087                nsteps += 1
1088            assert nsteps > 0, "autoencoder design: invalid parameters"
1089            self.ACinput *= 1.0 / nsteps
1090
1091        self.ACinput *= self.dfs[:, cells]
1092
1093    # END MotionNeural.autoencoder_design_matrix
1094
1095    def __getitem__(self, idx):
1096
1097        if len(self.cells_out) == 0:
1098            out = {
1099                "stim": self.stim[idx, :],
1100                "robs": self.robs[idx, :],
1101                "dfs": self.dfs[idx, :],
1102            }
1103            if self.speckled:
1104                out["Mval"] = self.Mval[idx, :]
1105                out["Mtrn"] = self.Mtrn[idx, :]
1106
1107        else:
1108            assert isinstance(self.cells_out, list), "cells_out must be a list"
1109            robs_tmp = self.robs[:, self.cells_out]
1110            dfs_tmp = self.dfs[:, self.cells_out]
1111            out = {
1112                "stim": self.stim[idx, :],
1113                "robs": robs_tmp[idx, :],
1114                "dfs": dfs_tmp[idx, :],
1115            }
1116            if self.speckled:
1117                M1tmp = self.Mval[:, self.cells_out]
1118                M2tmp = self.Mtrn[:, self.cells_out]
1119                out["Mval"] = M1tmp[idx, :]
1120                out["Mtrn"] = M2tmp[idx, :]
1121
1122        out["sacc_on"] = self.sacc_on[idx, :]
1123        out["sacc_off"] = self.sacc_off[idx, :]
1124        out["Xdrift"] = self.Xdrift[idx, :]
1125        if self.Xadapt is not None:
1126            out["Xadapt"] = self.Xadapt[idx, :]
1127        if self.ACinput is not None:
1128            out["ACinput"] = self.ACinput[idx, :]
1129
1130        if len(self.covariates) > 0:
1131            self.append_covariates(out, idx)
1132
1133        return out
1134
1135    # END MotionNeural.__get_item__()

Class for handling motion neural data.

MotionNeural(filename=None, num_lags=30, tr_gap=10, **kwargs) 
890    def __init__(self, filename=None, num_lags=30, tr_gap=10, **kwargs):
891        """
892        Args:
893            num_lags: number of lags to include in stimulus (default 30)
894            tr_gap: number of frames to blank out after each trial (default 10)
895            filename: currently the pre-processed matlab file from Dan's old-style format
896            datadir: directory for data (goes directly into SensoryBase)
897            **kwargs: non-dataset specific arguments that get passed into SensoryBase
898        """
899
900        # Call parent constructor
901        super().__init__(filename, **kwargs)
902        matdat = sio.loadmat(self.datadir + filename)
903        print("Loaded " + filename)
904
905        # Essential variables
906        self.robs = torch.tensor(matdat["robs"], dtype=torch.float32)
907        self.NT = len(self.robs)
908        self.dfs = torch.tensor(matdat["rf_criteria"], dtype=torch.float32)
909        self.NC = self.robs.shape[1]
910        self.ACinput = None  # autoencoder input
911
912        # Use stim onsets for stim timing (starts with black)
913        self.stimB = matdat["stimB"][:, 0].astype(np.float32)
914        self.stimW = matdat["stimW"][:, 0].astype(np.float32)
915        self.trial_stim = matdat["trial_stim"].astype(np.float32)
916        self.stimts = np.where(np.diff(self.stimB) > 0)[0] + 1
917        self.flash_stim = torch.zeros([self.NT, 1], dtype=torch.float32)
918        self.flash_stim[self.stimts] = 1.0
919        self.dims = [1, 1, 1, 1]
920        self.Xadapt = None
921
922        # Make trial block and classify trials
923        blocks = matdat["blocks"] - 1  # Convert to python indexing
924        trial_type_t = matdat["trial_type"][:, 0]
925        Ntr = len(blocks)
926        self.trial_type = np.zeros(Ntr, dtype=np.int64)  # 1=free viewing, 2=fixation
927        for bb in range(Ntr):
928            if bb < Ntr - 1:
929                self.block_inds.append(np.arange(blocks[bb], blocks[bb + 1]))
930            else:
931                self.block_inds.append(np.arange(blocks[bb], self.NT))
932            self.trial_type[bb] = np.median(trial_type_t[self.block_inds[bb]])
933
934        # Mask out blinks using data_filters +/ 4 frames around each blink
935        self.blinks = matdat["blinks"][:, 0].astype(np.float32)
936        valid_data = 1 - self.blinks
937        blink_onsets = np.where(np.diff(self.blinks) > 0)[0] + 1
938        blink_offsets = np.where(np.diff(self.blinks) > 0)[0] + 1
939        for ii in range(len(blink_onsets)):
940            valid_data[
941                range(
942                    np.maximum(0, blink_onsets[ii] - 4),
943                    np.minimum(self.NT, blink_offsets[ii] + 4),
944                )
945            ] = 0.0
946        self.dfs *= valid_data[:, None]
947        if tr_gap > 0:
948            for bb in range(Ntr):
949                self.dfs[self.block_inds[bb][:tr_gap], :] = 0.0
950
951        # Saccades
952        self.saccades = matdat["saccades"][:, 0].astype(np.float32)
953        saccade_onsets = np.where(np.diff(self.saccades) > 0)[0] + 1
954        saccade_offsets = np.where(np.diff(self.saccades) < 0)[0] + 1
955        self.sacc_on = torch.zeros([self.NT, 1], dtype=torch.float32)
956        self.sacc_on[saccade_onsets] = 1.0
957        self.sacc_off = torch.zeros([self.NT, 1], dtype=torch.float32)
958        self.sacc_off[saccade_offsets] = 1.0
959
960        # Non-essential
961        self.eye_pos = matdat["eye_pos"]
962        self.eye_speed = matdat["eye_speed"][:, 0]
963        self.framerate = matdat["framerate"][0, 0]
964        # Bharath's used time points
965        self.BTtimepts = matdat["timepts2use"][0, :] - 1  # Convert to python indexing
966
967        # Make drift term -- need anchors at every other cycle
968        transitions = np.where(abs(np.diff(self.trial_type)) > 0)[0] + 1
969        drift_anchors = [0] + list(
970            transitions[np.arange(1, len(transitions), 2)]
971        )  # every other transition
972        self.construct_drift_design_matrix(block_anchors=drift_anchors)
973
974        self.crossval_setup(test_set=False)
975
976        if num_lags is not None:
977            self.assemble_stimulus(num_lags=num_lags)
Arguments:
  • num_lags: number of lags to include in stimulus (default 30)
  • tr_gap: number of frames to blank out after each trial (default 10)
  • filename: currently the pre-processed matlab file from Dan's old-style format
  • datadir: directory for data (goes directly into SensoryBase)
  • **kwargs: non-dataset specific arguments that get passed into SensoryBase

def assemble_stimulus(self, which_stim='all', use_trial_type=False, num_lags=180): 
 981    def assemble_stimulus(self, which_stim="all", use_trial_type=False, num_lags=180):
 982        """
 983        Assembles stimulus for dataset.
 984
 985        Args:
 986            which_stim: could be 'trial' (default) using just the first stim onset" or could
 987                mark each flash (calling 'which_stim' anything else), although this would not implicitly
 988                take things like adapation into account
 989            use_trial_type: could fit different stim responses in the two conditions to gauge the effects
 990            num_lags: number of lags to include in stimulus (default 180)
 991        """
 992
 993        self.num_lags = num_lags
 994        if which_stim == "trial":
 995            stim = self.trial_stim
 996        else:
 997            stim = self.flash_stim.detach().numpy()
 998
 999        if use_trial_type:
1000            stim2 = np.concatenate((deepcopy(stim), deepcopy(stim)), axis=1)
1001            for bb in range(len(self.block_inds)):
1002                stim2[self.block_inds[bb], self.trial_type[bb] - 1] = 0.0
1003                # this will have stim present in 0 for fixation and 1 for free viewing
1004            self.stim = self.time_embedding(stim=stim2, nlags=num_lags)
1005            self.sac_dims = [2, 1, 1, num_lags]
1006        else:
1007            self.stim = self.time_embedding(stim=stim, nlags=num_lags)
1008            self.sac_dims = [1, 1, 1, num_lags]

  • use_trial_type: could fit different stim responses in the two conditions to gauge the effects
  • num_lags: number of lags to include in stimulus (default 180)

1012    def construct_Xadapt(self, tent_start=18 + 8, tent_spacing=20):
1013        """
1014        Constructs adaptation-within-trial tent function
1015        Args:
1016            tent_start: starting point for tent basis
1017            tent_spacing: spacing between tent basis
1018
1019        Returns:
1020            None
1021        """
1022        # Put first anchor
1023        anchors = tent_start + tent_spacing * np.arange(
1024            0, 6
1025        )  # 5 pulses (ignoring first)
1026
1027        # Generate master tent_basis
1028        trial_tents = self.design_matrix_drift(
1029            len(self.block_inds[0]),
1030            anchors,
1031            zero_left=True,
1032            const_left=True,
1033            zero_right=False,
1034            const_right=True,
1035        )
1036        num_tents = trial_tents.shape[1]
1037
1038        self.Xadapt = torch.zeros((self.NT, num_tents), dtype=torch.float32)

1041            L = len(self.block_inds[tr])
1042            self.Xadapt[self.block_inds[tr], :] = torch.tensor(
1043                trial_tents[:L, :], dtype=torch.float32
1044            )

def autoencoder_design_matrix(self, trial_level=False, pre_win=0, post_win=0, blank=0, cells=None): 
1048    def autoencoder_design_matrix(
1049        self, trial_level=False, pre_win=0, post_win=0, blank=0, cells=None
1050    ):
1051        """
1052        Makes auto-encoder input using windows described above, and including the
1053        chosen cells. Will put as additional covariate "ACinput" in __get_item__
1054
1055        Args:
1056            trial_level: whether to average over trials
1057            pre_win: how many time steps to include before origin
1058            post_win: how many time steps to include after origin
1059            blank: how many time steps to blank in each direction, including origin
1060            cells: which cells to include
1061        """
1062
1063        if cells is None:
1064            cells = np.arange(self.NC)
1065        Rraw = deepcopy(self.robs[:, cells])
1066        self.ACinput = torch.zeros(Rraw.shape, dtype=torch.float32)
1067
1068        if trial_level:
1069            assert (
1070                len(self.block_inds) > 0
1071            ), "No trials: trial-level autoencoder will not work."
1072            for tt in range(len(self.block_inds)):
1073                ts = self.block_inds[tt]
1074                self.ACinput[ts, :] = (
1075                    torch.ones([len(ts), 1]) @ torch.mean(Rraw[ts, :], axis=0)[None, :]
1076                )
1077        else:
1078            nsteps = 0
1079            if blank == 0:
1080                self.ACinput += Rraw
1081                nsteps = 1
1082            for ii in range(1, (pre_win + 1)):
1083                self.ACinput[ii:, :] += Rraw[:(-ii), :]
1084                nsteps += 1
1085            for ii in range(1, (post_win + 1)):
1086                self.ACinput[:(-ii), :] += Rraw[ii:, :]
1087                nsteps += 1
1088            assert nsteps > 0, "autoencoder design: invalid parameters"
1089            self.ACinput *= 1.0 / nsteps
1090
1091        self.ACinput *= self.dfs[:, cells]
